participants.recruitment_source: Recruited by phone; had previously participated in at least one unrelated paid lab experiment.

no_history_investment_game.population: undergraduate students at the University of Minnesota
no_history_investment_game.compensation: $10 show-up fee (plus earnings from the game)

social_history_investment_game.population: undergraduate students at the University of Minnesota

steps: Subjects are recruited and provided with a $10 show-up fee.

In the Social History treatment, subjects are provided with a report summarizing the results (amount sent, number of persons, average amount returned, and average profit) of the 32 pairs from the No History treatment.
Room A subjects decide how much of their $10 show-up fee to send to an anonymous counterpart in Room B.
The amount sent by Room A subjects is tripled by the experimenters.
Room B subjects receive the tripled amount and decide how much to send back to the person in Room A and how much to keep.
